Package com.deco2800.game.memento

Class PlayerStateManager

java.lang.Object
com.deco2800.game.memento.PlayerStateManager
public class PlayerStateManager
extends java.lang.Object
Singleton manager class used to manage player state. Currently, there is only 1 player state and it is updated when a new level is generated and when game is restarted/started. This class is responsible for updating, restoring and carrying that state from one level to another.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    PlayerStateManager()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addAndUpdatePlayerState​(Entity player, double gameLevel)
    Adds a new player state to internal memory and at the same time updates current player state that will be used in current game level and for checkpointing
    void createStartingPlayerState​(int baseRangedAttack, int baseAttack, int health, int ammo, int bandages, int gold, int woundState, int defenceLevel, int bullet, java.lang.String ability, java.lang.String meleeFilePath, java.lang.String meleeWeaponType, java.lang.String armorType, double currentGameLevel)
    This is used to create the first player state in game.

    Acquire current player state
    void destroy()
    Destroys singleton instance

    void restorePlayerState()
    Reverts player state to the first player state used when game was started and removes all other player state stored previously

    Reverts player state to the most recent safehouse visited before current level where player died.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static PlayerStateManager getInstance()
      Returns single instance of singleton
      Returns:
      player state manager instance

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Destroys singleton instance

    • currentPlayerState

      public Player currentPlayerState()
      Acquire current player state
      Returns:
      most recent created player state

    • createStartingPlayerState

      public void createStartingPlayerState​(int baseRangedAttack, int baseAttack, int health, int ammo, int bandages, int gold, int woundState, int defenceLevel, int bullet, java.lang.String ability, java.lang.String meleeFilePath, java.lang.String meleeWeaponType, java.lang.String armorType, double currentGameLevel)
      This is used to create the first player state in game. Player state will be restored to this when game is restarted by user in game
      Parameters:
      baseRangedAttack - amount of damage dealt by player via range
      baseAttack - amount of dadmage dealt by player via melee
      health - health of player in current state
      ammo - amount of ammo used for rnage attack
      bandages - used to heal player's wound state
      gold - amount of gold used to purchase items at player's current state
      woundState - wound state based on player's current state
      defenceLevel - of player in current state
      bullet - left in magazine of player
      currentGameLevel - current game level of player's current state
      ability - being used in player's current state
      meleeFilePath - loads data relevant to melee weapon which will correspond to player's current state
      meleeWeaponType - weapon type of current player's state
      armorType - armor type of current player's state

    • addAndUpdatePlayerState

      public void addAndUpdatePlayerState​(Entity player, double gameLevel)
      Adds a new player state to internal memory and at the same time updates current player state that will be used in current game level and for checkpointing
      Parameters:
      player - entity that is used to extract relevant information to be stored in player state
      gameLevel - track which level player is currently at for storage and restoring purposes

    • trackPlayerState

      public java.lang.String trackPlayerState​(Player playerState)
      Used specifically for logging purposes and debugging. Will be useful to track player's current state
      Parameters:
      playerState - print most recent player state to logging

    • restorePlayerState

      public void restorePlayerState()
      Reverts player state to the first player state used when game was started and removes all other player state stored previously

    • restorePlayerStateToClosestSafehouse

      public void restorePlayerStateToClosestSafehouse()
      Reverts player state to the most recent safehouse visited before current level where player died. This method will only be called when player dies in levels that are not in safehouse. This is assuming player cannot die in safehouse and should not be able to anyway. This function is not meant to be used when or if player dies in safehouse - and this should not happen either way which is not the intention of the game
